New Records: Chris Jordan became the first Englishman to claim a hat trick in T20 internationals.
Key Match Events: Chris Jordan grabbed four wickets off five balls in his last over to dismantle the U.S. for 115 runs in 18.5 overs.
Jos Buttler smashed 83 not out off 38 balls, including five sixes in one over against left-arm spinner Harmeet Singh, as England raced to 117-0 in 9.4 overs.
Post-Match Reflections: The Americansâ€™ fairy-tale World Cup debut, which included a historic victory against heavyweight Pakistan earlier in the tournament, ended with three straight Super Eight losses.
Miscellaneous Highlights: England secured its spot in the semifinals of the Twenty20 World Cup.
England also beat West Indies and finished the Super Eights with a net run-rate of 1.992.
South Africa, which is unbeaten in six games but has a net run-rate of 0.625, must avoid defeat against tournament co-host West Indies to qualify with England for the semifinals.
